column4: what does this command do exactly?  mount -t xfs -o rtdev=/dev/sdb4 /dev/sdb3 /mnt/media  ;  when i try to mount using gui it didn't work but when i used that command it worked? why is that?
what does this command do exactly?  mount -t xfs -o rtdev=/dev/sdb4 /dev/sdb3 /mnt/media  ;  when i try to mount using gui it didn't work but when i used that command it worked? why is that?
a guess - it's a partition on a fixed drive that you didn't have the permissions to mount it
as for what it does, it mounts the device /dev/sdb3 on  /mnt/media and places the journal on /dev/sdb4
